Chapter I

On a super hot July evening, a young guy stepped out of his tiny attic room in S. Place and slowly made his way toward K. bridge, like he was unsure about something. 

He had just dodged his landlady on the stairs. His attic was more like a cupboard at the top of a tall, five-story building. The landlady lived one floor down and every time he left, he had to walk past her kitchen, which was always open. Each time he passed, he felt sick and ashamed. He was deep in debt to her and really didn’t want to run into her.

It wasn’t that he was a coward; actually, it was the opposite. Lately, he’d been super stressed and on edge, almost to the point of being paranoid. He was so wrapped up in his own head and cut off from others that he dreaded seeing not just his landlady but anyone at all. Poverty was weighing him down, but oddly, he had stopped worrying about it as much. He had lost all motivation to deal with real-life stuff. Nothing his landlady could do scared him anymore. But to be...

**PAGE SUMMARY:** A young man, burdened by debt and isolation, hesitates to leave his cramped garret due to his fear of encountering his landlady.
